actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment

official_title: To express the sense of the House of Representatives that the Secretary of State should encourage the European Commission to vote to ban all large-scale driftnet fishing by all European Community fishing fleets.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the Secretary of State should communicate to members of the European Community the U.S. support for an immediate ban on all large-scale driftnet fishing by European Community fishing fleets.

titles.title: To express the sense of the House of Representatives that the Secretary of State should encourage the European Commission to vote to ban all large-scale driftnet fishing by all European Community fishing fleets.
